questionTitle: ________ Wireless operates services are based on a Wi-Fi Positioning System (WPS).
questionExplanation: The advantage of WPS is that there are hundreds of millions of Wi-Fi access points worldwide and they are closer to the mobile device.

questionOption2: MEMS as a class can be between 1000 and 100000 micrometers in size
questionOption3: Several MEMS are packaged in smartphones
questionExplanation: MEMS as a class can be between 1 and 1000 micrometers in size.

questionTitle: Which of the following system is constantly polling locations to update them and recalibrating data points to improve accuracy over time?
questionExplanation: The system uses a large reference database of Wi-Fi access points and cell tower IDs, raw position data from each location source (a signal), and the company’s proprietary algorithm to locate the device.

questionTitle: Which of the following has a Java API that works with the Skyhook network?
questionExplanation: Loki has its browser plug-in to locate users for subscribing Websites.

questionOption1: MEMS is a class of very small sensor or actuator devices where small mechanical systems are driven by electricity to indicate a position
questionOption2: The incorporation of low-cost geo-sensors in the form of GPS chips into mobile devices opens the mobile user to a whole range of services based on the client’s location
questionOption3: The iPhone uses the proximity sensor to turn the screen off when a user puts the phone to his face
questionExplanation: There are many more contexts that can be used in processing client requests and returning relevant information.

questionTitle: Which of the following service is an example of push technology?
questionExplanation: The opposite of a push is a pull technology, in which the client polls for and requests a transaction.

questionTitle: The IRC protocol and the XMPP IM and VoIP protocol are examples of ______ push technologies.
questionExplanation: The XMPP PubSub extension is how Apple creates a push service for MobileMe.

questionTitle: Which of the following transport protocol combined with XMPP can be used for push service?
questionExplanation: BOSH stands for Bidirectional Streams Over Synchronous HTTP.

questionTitle: In the parlance of system design, the active transfer process is referred to as “push” and server is called _______
questionExplanation: client is called Mail User Agent(MUA).

questionTitle: Which of the following push technology is similar to SMTP?
questionExplanation: Push-IMAP stands for the Push extensions for Internet Message Access Protocol.
